net.cloud.gfx

Class DrawLogic

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.cloud.gfx.DrawLogic
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class DrawLogic
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    This runnable object will run in a loop and have the game graphics redrawn. By nature of the RootPanel, the graphics should be double buffered and should retry drawing if the graphics were altered why drawing.
    The idea here is that drawing should be continuous and not cause any blocking behavior with other tasks on the graphic hierarchy.

      The image to draw to, so that what is being drawn to screen is as fast as possible
      private java.awt.Graphics2D onGfx
      A graphics object associated with the onScreen image
      private java.awt.image.BufferedImage onScreen
      A ready-to-go completely-drawn image to draw to the game screen
      private boolean running
      Flag as to whether or not drawing is still going on.
      private java.lang.Object swapLock
      An object to lock on so we don't swap the images while one is being drawn to screen

    • Constructor Detail

      • DrawLogic

        public DrawLogic(javax.swing.JPanel drawPanel,
                 java.util.function.Supplier<Element> elementRoot)
        Create a new DrawThread which will repaint the given JPanel. This will not start itself. It must be wrapped in a thread and started.
        Parameters:
        drawPanel - the JPanel that will draw the graphic hierarchy
        elementRoot - The element serving as the root to the graphic hierarchy

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Repaint the graphics in a timed loop. Seeks to maintain the frame rate defined in ConfigConstants. If for some reason drawing falls below this frame rate, the loop will run constantly without delay.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • drawOnScreen

        public void drawOnScreen(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Uses the current on screen image and draws it to the provided graphics object
        Parameters:
        g - The graphics object to draw to

      • setRunning

        public void setRunning(boolean flag)
        Call this with a parameter of false to stop the loop. Once stopped, will not restart.
        Parameters:
        flag - False to stop drawing
